name: PacVoid
description:
This is my submission for AIT's student's Game Jam titled Genesis

Game is simple, you control a ball like creature and your mission is to reach other end of the level where you have to hack a computer(or something like that). This game features Film Grain effect(which in India we call mosquitoes on tv), so don't think that your monitor is borken or my game has poor graphics. Graphics levels can be set at runtime using option menu. 

Controls :-

WSAD / Arrow Keys : Movement

Left Mouse Button : Fire Laser

Z : Slow Time

X : Activate Shield

Left Ctrl : Start Hacking

E : Move Box with You

Level redisgnes itself after every game. Background music changes too.

For best graphics results, play Desktop version.

Warning : My naming skill sucks(as you may have seen after reading title of this game). There may be some bugs, so please report them ASAP so that I can take action against them.

Gameplay experience may differ in Standalone Desktop version and WebGl version.

Pacman image is just for indications. I am not creator of Pacman.

WebGL version : https://simmer.io/@generalpy/pacvoid(Several bugs found )

Edit [24 Dec 2020 2:40 PM] : Shield count is not changing, cannot upload new version due to voting so please ignore this little bug.

Made with Unity 2019.4 LTS version by Prakash Yogi.
